trigger.comments: Check pg_stat_activity view. If it is non-OLTP database, feel free to ignore.
Check pg_stat_activity view. If it is non-OLTP database, feel free to ignore.

trigger.description: PgSQL: prepared transaction exists for too long (>15 min)
trigger.comments: Check pg_prepared_xacts view. If it is non-OLTP database, feel free to ignore.

trigger.description: PgSQL: prepared transaction exists for too long (>5 min)
trigger.comments: Check pg_prepared_xacts view. If it is non-OLTP database, feel free to ignore.

trigger.description: PgSQL: tnx is too long in idle state (> 1 min)

trigger.comments: ZTC was unable to connect to database and execute simple query. Please check that postgres is up and you have correct ztc configuration. For more info, run /opt/ztc/bin/pgsql.py ping -d

trigger.description: PgSQL: too close to to autovacuum_freeze_max_age on {HOSTNAME}
trigger.comments: Run `/opt/ztc/bin/pgsql.py autovac_freeze -d` to chech what databases caused this and vacuum them

trigger.description: PgSQL: checkpoints are happening too frequently on {HOSTNAME}
PgSQL: more than 90% of available connections are in use on {HOSTNAME}
PgSQL: more than 80% of available connections used on {HOSTNAME}

item.description: PgSQL dbstat: tuples inserted per sec
PgSQL: nr of connections established to postgresql server
PgSQL: nr of connections idle in transaction
PgSQL: dbstat: Blocks read per sec
PgSQL dbstat: tuples returned per sec
PgSQL: max number of possible connections
PostgreSQL cur max idle transaction time
PgSQL: max age of running query
PgSQL: max age of prepared transaction
PgSQL bgwriter: data written during checkpoints
PgSQL bgwriter: data written by the background writer
PgSQL bgwriter: number of times the bgwriter stopped because it had written too many buffers
PgSQL bgwriter: data written directly by a backend
